column4: Does anybody have an explanation for why gtkpod keeps setting my podcasts to the "not yet listened to" state?
combined knowledge as a team, lots can be done
anything specific I should look for?
does Ubuntu shut down automatically when you press power button once ?
Actually it goes to a password prompt screen, which seems to work intermittently.  Most recently the system was unresponsive to the keyboard and I had to hold down the power key to do a reboot
what version Ubuntu you running ? i seen that in 7.x
Also, when it is "waking up" to get to that (intermittently working) password prompt, it reported a bunch of I/O errors on device sdb1
that was meant for you> what version ?
ACPI function allows for that, thats about all i can tell you. you can disable it if need be
all acpi reports is the battery state, ac charger state, and temperature (the terminal command acpi that is) - haven't tried the cmos yet
sure would be nice to be able to edit the cmos without rebooting (sigh)
you can try and disable it there to see if it works for you, but your ACPI functions will also be disabled
well I'd rather get it to work; I can disable it by setting the suspend time to "never" - but was wondering if anybody knows what is going on, or how to identify device "sdb1"
